title: RemoteJuggler Campaign Definition
description: Declarative test campaign for agent-driven code analysis, security scanning, and self-improvement.

description.description: Detailed description of what the campaign does and why

model.description: Override the default model for this campaign (e.g. 'claude-sonnet-4-20250514', 'claude-haiku-4-5-20251001')

mode.description: Execution mode: 'schema' follows process steps linearly, 'autonomous' allows free reasoning and adaptation. Defaults to schema for readOnly campaigns, autonomous for writable.

schedule.description: Cron expression for scheduled runs (e.g. '0 2 * * 1' for Mon 2am)

event.description: Event type that triggers this campaign

dependsOn.description: Campaign IDs that must complete before this one starts (for cross-agent orchestration)

pathFilters.description: Glob patterns that trigger on push/PR events (e.g. 'gateway/*.go')

forge.description: Which forge hosts the target repo

repo.description: Repository name (use '*' for all repos in org)

tools.description: MCP tool names this campaign uses (for documentation and validation)

setecKey.description: Setec key prefix for storing results (e.g. 'remotejuggler/campaigns/oc-dep-audit')

pvcPath.description: PVC path for large result artifacts (HexStrike only)

issueLabels.description: Labels applied to auto-created GitHub issues

issueRepo.description: Repo for issue creation (org/repo format, defaults to target repo)

readOnly.description: If true, campaign cannot create branches, PRs, or modify repos

allowedBranches.description: Branch name patterns the campaign may create (requires readOnly=false)

requireApproval.description: If true, PRs require human approval before merge

killSwitch.description: Command to immediately stop this campaign

maxTokens.description: Maximum AI API tokens per run

maxCostUSD.description: Maximum AI API cost per run in USD

closeResolvedIssues.description: Auto-close issues when subsequent run shows fix

successCriteria.description: Human-readable description of what constitutes a successful run

kpis.description: Key performance indicators tracked over time (e.g. 'version_divergences', 'cve_count')
